conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid A (cyan) starts from the top left position.
Liquid A flows down through the green baffle.
Liquid A continues straight down past the grey baffle.
Liquid A ends up in container E (red).
Liquid B (yellow) starts from the second position from the top left.
Liquid B flows down through the grey baffle.
Liquid B turns right and flows past the pink and black baffles.
Liquid B ends up in container G (orange).
Liquid C (orange) starts from the middle top position.
Liquid C flows down through the purple baffle.
Liquid C ends up in container F (grey).
Liquid D (pink) starts from the top right position.
Liquid D flows down directly through the pink baffle.
Liquid D ends up in container G (orange).
Based on the analysis, Liquid A flows into container E, Liquid B flows into container G, Liquid C flows into container F, and Liquid D flows into container G.
Final Answer: Liquid A: Container E, Liquid B: Container G, Liquid C: Container F, Liquid D: Container G.
